newsitem.title: USA: RAILTEX to take Q3 charge of $0.07 a shr.
newsitem.headline: RAILTEX to take Q3 charge of $0.07 a shr.

text.p: RailTex said Monday it expects to take a $600,000 charge in the third quarter equalling $0.07 per share.
The company said the charge is due to casualty losses affected by an increase in its self-insured retentions in the third quarter.
For the second quarter RailTex reported per share earnings of $0.28, including an after-tax charge of $1.39 million, or $0.15 a share.

The expected $600,000 charge for the third quarter comes from a derailment and a personal injury claim that happened after RailTex increased its self-insured retentions, which raised its deductible, said Joe Jahnke, the company's treasury manager.
The company is scheduled to report its third quarter earnings November 6, Jahnke said.
RailTex said August carloadings on a "same railroad" basis increased 11.5 percent. For the year-to-date, carloadings on a "same railroad" basis increased 10.5 percent.
